alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 10:04PM PDT until further notice by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Orange, Riverside and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 100 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.4 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen over the past 3 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.40 to 0.60 inches are expected tonight. Additional rain will result in minor flooding. Rain is expected to continue overnight and will be heavy at times. Rates of 0.25 to locally 0.50 inches per hour expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Ana, Irvine, Huntington Beach, southern Corona, Costa Mesa, Mission Viejo, Tustin, San Clemente, Laguna Beach and Dana Point. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
